intro: Heterotropa senkakuinsularis, commonly known as the Okinawa island heterotropa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Senkaku Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often on rocky substrates. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
